translations: n.[计量]毫秒（millisecond 的复数形式）

sentences.sentence: All of this action takes place within about 100 milliseconds after the fly first spots the swatter.
sentences.translation: 在苍蝇觉察到苍蝇拍之后，这一整套动作在约100毫秒内发生。

sentences.sentence: With roughly 48 hours to do the job, Santa only has a little over 0.2 milliseconds to scamper between households.
sentences.translation: 圣诞老人有大约48个小时来完成这项工作，因此他只有超过0.2毫秒少许的时间在每个住户间疾走。

sentences.sentence: As Kunar and Horowitz report, those who were making the equivalent of a hands-free call had an average reaction time 212 milliseconds slower than those who were not.
sentences.translation: 库纳尔和霍洛维茨报告说，那些使用免提电话之类的人，他们的平均反应时间比不使用免提电话的人慢212毫秒。
